channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Heteroaromatic π-stacking engineered near-infrared absorption for highly stable near-zero transmittance electrochromic window
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64955-1

Electrochromic materials have been used in thermal management systems though it is challenging due to limited NIR and long-term instability. Here the authors design an electrochromic organogel for stable electrochromic windows.
item.dc:title: Heteroaromatic π-stacking engineered near-infrared absorption for highly stable near-zero transmittance electrochromic window
item.dc:creator: Xilu Wu
Bingwei Bao
Zhiyuan Bai
Qingchao Fan
Chengyi Hou
Qinghong Zhang
Yaogang Li
Weizhong Jiang
Kerui Li
Hongzhi Wang

item.title: Achieving electrochemical and mechanical stability in a lightweight titanium alloy
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64875-0

Seawater corrosion can impact the lifespan and reliability of metallic materials for marine applications. This work develops a titanium alloy exhibiting active passivation behavior that ensures its electrochemical and mechanical stability in seawater-like environments.
item.dc:title: Achieving electrochemical and mechanical stability in a lightweight titanium alloy
item.dc:creator: Jixun Zhang
Jianyang Zhang
Weicheng Xiao
Xier Luo
Xia Li
Na Li
Hong Luo
Peter K. Liaw
Tao Yang
